Name: Painted wooden figure of Ptah-Sokar-Osiris
Description: Painted wooden figure of Ptah-Sokar-Osiris, with red background wrapping, and a column of hieroglyphs down the lower front body. The surface is much worn, and the pedestal and crown of the body are lost. Such figures were placed in the tomb as guarantors of rebirth, in rich burials of the 1st millennium BC.
